products.name: Pillars of Slippers
products.description: Nicole Jones loved shoes. It was only natural that she go into the shoe business. Her company, Pillars of Slippers, included a brick-and-mortar retail store, a website and, her favorite, home shoe parties (picture a more-fun, fancier, hipper Tupperware party). For a home party, Nicole would roll up in her pink SUV, roll out her pink carpet and dance her way into the living rooms, giving the guests champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries. Center stage were the shoes: comfortable, affordable,

products.name: Llama Brew – Plant Food Made From Llama Manure
products.description: Llama manure? Really? Yes! Yes! Llama Brew Plant Food has advantages that llama manure brings to your garden. Llamas have three stomachs that digest everything fully. So llamas leave their best behind for your favorite flowers, plants, vegetables and herbs. Llama Brew cannot “burn” your plants and needs no composting.

products.name: Nubrella Hands Free Umbrella
products.description: Nubrella Inc. is located just outside of metropolitan Boston. The company owns numerous patents throughout the US and Internationally. Nubrella released it’s first ‘bubble’ like design in 2010. Alan presented this fully enclosed model on Shark Tank.

products.name: Qubits – Educational Toy
products.description: Everyone is familiar with Legos, K’nex and other building toys. For decades, children have been playing with these and others that are similar. There’s no doubt many engineers and architects today discovered their passion through building something with these toys on their bedroom floor.

products.name: Lipstix Remix
products.description: Ladies, don’t you hate when you can’t get all the lipstick out of the tube? Lipstick is made that way; at least 1/3 of it is needed to anchor the lipstick in the tube. Jill Quillin didn’t like wasting all that money, so she founded her company Divine Innovations and created LipStix ReMix, a kit that allows women to scoop out that “anchor” and mix it up with others to make new shades.

products.name: Captain Ice Cream
products.description: Tim Gavern grew up in the ice cream business. His grandmother and mother both owned ice cream parlors, but Tim took a different route. He went into publishing as an editor of a car magazine. As the publishing business declined, Tim decided to pivot—turning to the traditional family business, selling ice cream. Instead of opening a parlor, he bought a custom-made moped/ice cream freezer combination and became Captain Ice Cream. It was just like in the old days, neighborhood kids waiting for the i

products.name: Caffeindicator
products.description: Michael Shiavone ordered a decaf coffee late one night, then couldn’t sleep. He knew the server had made a mistake and given him caffeinated. Surely others experienced the same thing, and he wondered if he could find a solution. Michael developed and patented the Caffeindicator, a litmus-like test for sweetener packets that does not affect the contents of the packet. Dip the packet into the coffee. If the test area changes color, the coffee is caffeinated.

products.name: Wee Can Shop
products.description: Sister and brother, Kimberley and Matthew Foley, were the owners and creators of Wee Can Shop, a mini shopping mall where children could shop for gifts for their loved ones. The children push small shopping carts from store front to store front (e.g., shops with kitchen items, candles, accessories) in search of the perfect gift. Once they purchase their selections, they can then wrap the gifts as a finishing touch. Kimberley believes this is a completely unique idea that can grow into a nationwi

products.name: The Factionist
products.description: Nate Berkopec was a New York University business student. His clothing line, The Factionist, was made up of environmentally friendly T-shirts made in Uganda and silk-screened with socially relevant messages, such as “1.75 billion people live on less than $1.25 a day. Buy fair-trade.” and “If you don’t, who will?” Nate wanted to make the world a better place through his casual clothing. His target demographic was his own, 16- to 24-year-olds, the “most socially aware generation of our time.” In t

products.name: Grease Monkey Wipes
products.description: Grease Monkey Wipes are an individually packaged degreasing and cleaning wipe that utilizes a natural, non-toxic, citric-based cleaning agent to handle heavy duty cleaning. Not any ordinary antibacterial wipes, these are designed to clean the heaviest messes of nasty grease and grime. Safe for the environment, these handy and powerful wipes are perfect for the mom with kids that are always getting into a mess. Grease Monkey Wipes offer industrial strength cleaning without the harsh chemicals. Yo

products.name: PODillow
products.description: Lying by the pool or on the beach is relaxing. You get to chill and catch some sun without a care in the world, but when you need to flip to get some sun on your back, it can be hard to get comfortable. A towel doesn’t make for a great pillow when lying face down.

products.name: The Twister Golf Ball Cleaner
products.description: Inventor and police officer Alfonzo Dowe was a long-time die-hard golfer and knew that golf balls need to be perfectly clean to perform well, plus clean golf balls last longer. Most players carry a damp towel with them to wipe off the balls. That’s not the most efficient or convenient solution, so Alfonzo created a portable golf ball cleaner, the Twister, that is lightweight and portable. Golfers can slip the Twister into their golf bags and not have to depend on the stationary ball wash station

products.name: Hell’s Bells Helmets
products.description: Marix Stone was a sculptor who had been designing custom-made motorcycle helmets for years. He and his company’s CEO, Nancy Tanchel, had turned what was essentially a hobby into a full-fledged business, Hells Bells Helmets, that produces and sells patented, custom-designed, 3D-sculpted helmets that are certified by the Department of Transportation. Marix started with a standard safety helmet and not only turned it into a work of art but also a safer helmet. The patent basically makes Hells Bells

products.name: Chef in Black
products.description: Dorene Humason spent more than 20 years in the food industry as a buyer and sales representative. She worked hard and put in long hours and finally decided to put all that time, effort and her background in the culinary arts into her own company, Chef in Black. Her product was Jaden Chinese Salad Dressing and Seasoning Mix—all natural and gluten free and could also be used as a stir fry seasoning or a marinade.

products.name: Romp and Roll
products.description: In 2004, Romp n’ Roll founders Babz and Michael Barnett opened the first location. Parents themselves, they recognized the shortage of high-quality classes and programs for little ones when their son was young. Their goal was to create contemporary child development programs with a wide variety of enriching classes, and their research led them to discover the value of a play-based curriculum.

products.name: The Uro Club
products.description: Dr. Floyd Seskin was a urologist in Florida. Many of his patients were men, and many of those men were golfers. He often heard about a particular predicament on the golf course: There was no place to pee. One man solved the problem by slicing his ball into the woods when he needed to, but there were not always woods on the courses. They wanted a solution, and Floyd invented the Uro Club, a portable urinal of sorts. The Uro Club looks like a 7 iron with a wider grip that serves as a reservoir. A

products.name: The Bobble Place Bobbleheads
products.description: Jeff Wolsky always loved bobbleheads—those dolls whose heads keep bobbing up and down. And he always wanted a bobblehead of himself. He had to start his own business, The Bobble Place, to get his custom-made bobblehead. On the website, customers send in photos of themselves, family members or friends, and the custom bobbleheads are sculpted. Jeff had already sold more than 1,000,000 dolls and was making $550,000 a year.

products.name: Mr. Poncho Earbuds Holder
products.description: Sandy Hyun and Roman Pietrs, jewelry designer and graphic artist respectively, invented Mr. Poncho as a solution to a common problem. Three hundred million people own an MP3 player and two hundred million own a smart phone. That adds up to 500 million tangled headphone cords. Mr. Poncho is a colorful, whimsically designed sleeve. Slide the MP3 player/smart phone into the sleeve. Pop up the rubber cup/cord holder on the side of the sleeve and wrap/unwrap the headphone cords. So simple a solution.

products.name: Chill Soda
products.description: Dan Mackey created a healthy alternative to traditional sodas. The teachers in his family were appalled when California got rid of sodas in the schools, but replaced them with beverages that were not any healthier. They were juices and sports drinks with as many, maybe more, calories than the sodas. Dan’s Chill Soda was uniquely low glycemic. It had no high-fructose corn syrup and no simple sugars. It was sweetened with agave nectar, as nutritious as honey and sweeter than sugar. Chill Soda cont

products.name: Virtusphere VR Platform
products.description: Virtusphere is a VR platform allowing users to be fully immersed into an interactive virtual experience. It expands the experience provided by modern VR helmets by allowing them to move in the virtual environment.

products.name: Gayla Bentley Fashion
products.description: Gayla Bentley was a fashion designer of high-end clothing for women sizes 12 through 28. Gayla calls them the “modern women,” because 60% of women in the US fit into that category. Gayla said they are all tired of being ignored by fashion designers or needing to shop in the far reaches of department stores. She had four beautifully clothed models with her to demonstrate her brand.

products.name: Throx Socks Sold in Threes
products.description: Throx are socks sold in packs of three and playfully marketed as the cure for the missing sock, an irritating phenomenon we’ve all experienced. The product line was created by writer-director Edwin Heaven, who offers a simple solution for socks that have mysteriously lost their partner – sell socks that come with a spare. Edwin didn’t secure an investment during his short appearance on Shark Tank but Throx are still available through his website.

products.name: Washed Up Hollywood Belts & Buckles
products.description: Update: Washed Up Hollywood has been discontinued.

products.name: Treasure Chest Pets Toys with Hidden Compartments
products.description: Treasure Chest Pets was a line of plush stuffed animal toys, created by Lisa Lloyd, with hidden compartments for storing children’s personal belongings and treasures. Lisa was able to secure an investment from Daymond John and Barbara Corcoran, and saw some early success selling through Buy Buy Baby,  however Lisa closed down Treasure Chest Pets in 2012 citing business missteps and a flood of competition from knock offs. Despite closing the business , Lisa says the experience was a positive one.

products.name: Funhouse Amusement Park
products.description: Todd Robbins was a magician engaged in off-the-beaten-track entertainment. David Adamovich was a PhD in a kinesiology, an ordained minister and manager of a billiard hall. When he turned 50, he decided to “follow his bliss” and became a knife thrower (aka impalement artist). As the Great Throwdini, he set 25 world records and was generally acknowledged as the world’s best knife thrower.

products.name: Boogie Box Fitness
products.description: Dede Barbanti-Parra and Kathy Lamm brought with them two women and a man to vigorously demonstrate a Boogie Box Fitness routine. Kevin O’Leary commented that it looked very hard to do. To show him it wasn’t, they brought Kevin up to show him some exercises.

products.name: Soy-Yer-Dough
products.description: Sawyer Sparks was studying agriculture economics at Purdue University when he learned that his  professor’s daughter suffered from celiac disease. The digestive disorder is triggered by, among other things, wheat. For the five-year-old, that meant that she could not play with Play-Doh. All of her friends had so much fun playing with the modeling compound, but it contained wheat.

products.name: Grill Charms
products.description: Similar in concept to the wine charm these dime-sized solid stainless steel charms are placed in your food before grilling. The stems are serrated to hold securely while grilling, moving and flipping. Never lose track of which steak is yours with Grill Charms. Use them to distinguish flavors, spices, temperatures or allergy issues.

products.name: Soul’s Calling Inspirational Gifts
products.entrepreneur: hoped to use these products to spread positivity
products.description: Soul’s Calling offered gifts and accessories with a positive message and positive energy. The product line included the Inspirella, an umbrella with happy messages printed on it like “You Are My Sunshine”. The entrepreneur hoped to use these products to spread positivity, and gave a very touching pitch about her mission of happiness and healing. At the time of this post, the Soul’s Calling website is defunct and the company appears to no longer exist. The creator of Soul’s Calling went into the

products.name: Coverplay Play Yard Slip Cover
products.description: Every mother appreciates having a clean, safe space for their child to play.  A portable play yard or playpen often fits the bill.  Unfortunately since they come in direct contact with toddlers, playpens get spilled, dripped and drooled on, and incur any number of other indignities. Suffice it to say that this particular piece of furniture gets very dirty and is also hard to clean.

products.name: Gift Card Rescue
products.description: Each year 10% of all gift cards go unused. You may have one or two tucked away yourself. Maybe it’s not convenient to go to the store’s location to use the card, or perhaps you haven’t found anything you needed. Gift Card Rescue can turn those unused cards into cash. Just go to their website, enter your gift card information, and they will tell you how much they will pay you for it. The payment is typically 65-70% of the value of the card, and can be transferred into your PayPal account within 2

products.name: The Fizz Ice Cream Floats
products.description: The Fizz is the ice cream float reinvented for the modern world. It’s a clever attachment, loaded with delicious ice cream, that screws onto the top of a plastic soda bottle. The Fizz mixes the soda and ice cream and makes root beer float on the go. The creator of The Fizz went into the Shark Tank asking for $150k for a 25% share of the company, but left without an investment.

products.name: Pork Barrel BBQ Sauce
products.description: Only guys who’ve worked on Capitol Hill could come up with a name like “Pork Barrel” for their barbecue sauce and spice rubs. Founded in 2008 by two young Senate staffers, Pork Barrel BBQ was born out of their frustration at not being able to find real, down home barbecue in Washington, DC like they were used to back in their native Missouri.

products.name: Kalyx Sports Bras
products.description: Kalyx Technologies makes comfortable sports bras that offer a solution to exercise induced breast pain. The creator of Kalyx went into the Shark Tank asking for $125k for a 20% share of the company, but didn’t get an investment.

products.name: EverlyWell Home Health Tests
products.entrepreneur: to Watch for 2017 by CIO (Chief Information Officer) Magazine
products.description: EverlyWell is perfectly poised to become an integral part of the “do-it-yourself healthcare” trend with its at-home tests that check hormone levels, blood sugar, cholesterol and much more. We are accustomed to monitoring blood pressure, heart rate and body temperature with apps on smart phones and tablets. A cool wrist band lets us know how well we’ve slept, how far we’ve walked, how many calories we’ve burned. At-home pregnancy tests have been around for many years and HIV tests for several. Di

products.name: ToyBox 3D Printer For Kids
products.description: After Ben Baltes earned a BS in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Austin in 2013, he worked as an animator for Indie-Pop and a Software Engineering Intern at Sotera Defense Solutions. While working for Microsoft as a Software Engineer he became well versed in the emerging technologies of 3D Printers and virtual reality. Baltes and several of his tech friends would often get together and toss around ideas for apps, software and creative uses for emerging technologies.

products.name: Budsies Custom Plush Animals
products.description: Children are overflowing with creativity and you want to do everything you can to encourage that. Childhood drawings become treasured keepsakes and cherished memories. Now you can turn your child’s artwork into reality, by having it made into a custom plush stuffed animal by Budsies. Just upload your child’s masterpiece to the Budsies website. Their team of artists will hand make your unique creation using high quality, hypo-allergenic materials and send it to your door. Your child will be overj

products.name: PROVEN Skincare
products.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the beauty industry, and PROVEN Skincare is in the vanguard. AI is the ability of a computer to assess a colossal amount of information, draw rational conclusions and select relevant details faster than is humanly possible. It is Netflix recommending movies based on everything they know about us. It is Alexa, like the smartest personal assistant ever, answering questions, reporting on weather and traffic, scheduling our appointments, reading to us,

products.name: The Woobles Crochet Kits
products.description: Justine Tiu and Adrian Zhang met as undergraduates at Duke University when they were in the same chemistry class. (Justine likes to joke that “we had chemistry—literally!”) They both went on to work in high-powered jobs in New York City. Justine was a User Experience Designer at Google. Adrian spent seven years as a Wall Street trader.

products.name: Sleep Pod Blanket by Hug Sleep
products.description: When Angie and Matt appeared on Shark Tank in October 2020 and made a deal with Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban, they had almost $500,000 in Sleep Pod sales. Overnight, sales skyrocketed to $2,000,000. Now, only five months later, sales are more than $4,000,000.

products.name: McMiller Party Games
products.description: Julian Miller went on a blind date with David McGranaghan in 2010. They hit it off, which is lucky, because a few years later they would move in together, get married, and start a company that sells banana tails, cardboard pirate ships, and cat paw mitts to people all over the world. None of that was the plan. At the time, Julian was acting in musicals and commercials. David was in the West End production of Jersey Boys, wearing wigs and high heels. But it turned out they both liked silly games.

products.name: Bauble Stockings
products.description: In Kate Stice Stewart’s family, the last Christmas gift wasn’t the biggest or flashiest. It wasn’t a dirt bike or a PS2. It was something thoughtful, hidden in a little hand-stitched stocking that hung high on the tree like it had special clearance from Santa. They called it the bauble stocking. It held either the final gift or a clue to it. Something small, personal, and usually meant for her mom as a kind of year-end thank you from the whole family. A book she didn’t ask for but someone knew s

products.name: Edible Architecture
products.description: Avital Ungar has always been in the business of getting people to eat things together. For over a decade, she ran food tours and events under the name Avital Food & Drink Experiences. Walking tours, cocktail tastings, team offsites where someone ends up eating goat cheese off a rooftop in San Francisco. That sort of thing. Her job was basically hosting parties for strangers, then making sure no one left hungry or bored.

products.name: The Christmas Carolers
products.description: Kenyon Ross just wanted to make some extra money at Christmas. He was a singer. He knew other singers. People liked holiday music. It was pretty straightforward: get a few friends together, wear something festive, sing at office parties, and pass the hat. That first year, it was all local—just Birmingham, Alabama. They’d pile into a car with scarves and pitch pipes, show up at a party, sing “We Wish You a Merry Christmas”, and move on to the next one. No website. No booking form. Just singing.

products.name: Onesole – The Original Interchangeable Shoes
products.description: Onesole helps you put your best foot forward. Created by Dominique McClain Barteet, Onesole is known as “The Original Interchangeable Shoe.” The brand embodies style, comfort, and convenience. It offers a variety of soles that can be mixed and matched with your choice of tops. Each one can snap on and off within a matter of seconds.

products.name: Samson Martin Maternity Clothes
products.description: Kim Preis wanted to create a line of maternity clothes that are elegant and flattering. She also wanted them to have an element of fun, something that made them stand out from the crowd. Her Samson Martin line included items imprinted with the baby’s due date, month or season. Mom is saved from answering that question throughout the day, and it lets others know who do not ask.

products.name: Aldo Orta Jewelry
products.description: Aldo Orta was an artist as far back as he could remember. After receiving a Fine Arts degree in his native Mexico City, he moved to Los Angeles and earned a second degree from the University of California. Aldo’s primary interest was environmental design, and living in LA gave him opportunities to design sets for music videos and concerts.

products.name: Hy-conn Water Hose Connector
products.description: Hy-Conn is a patent pending product 11 years in the making. Elegant in design and function, the super-fast connector will save thousands of lives and millions of dollars in property.

products.name: Man Candles With Manly Scents
products.entrepreneur: in Shark Tank history to get the panel of billionaire investors to smell his farts
products.description: Nathan Thornberry, creator of the Original Man Candle, is the only entrepreneur in Shark Tank history to get the panel of billionaire investors to smell his farts. While he did not get an investment, that is still a unique accomplishment. The Original Man Candle comes in several other manly odors, besides farts, like Bacon and Golf Course.

products.name: OrigAudio – Turn Anything into a Speaker
products.description: Stick this Rock-It pod onto any hollow object and instantly turn it into a speaker. Perfect for taking the party with you. Simply press play on your device, stick the Rock-It on whatever is around, and rock out. Origaudio also makes fold-up cardboard speakers and other inventive products that are small enough to fit in your pocket.

products.name: Carsik Bib
products.description: Les Cookson’s two sons were prone to carsickness. After so many times cleaning up and fumigating the car, Les had to find another way. His Carsik Bib, essentially a “barf bag,” hung from a child’s neck to catch the vomit and had a padded bottom to absorb liquid and eliminate odor. To demonstrate, Les had a ghastly child-substitute (think Munch’s The Scream) in a car seat. He poured pea soup into its head, and it spewed out the mouth onto the floor and his shoes. Which grossed everyone out. Then

products.name: Hydromax Wearable Water Bottle
products.description: Chris Spencer thought up the basic idea for HydroMax when he was a kid playing football and out on the field thirsty. The HydroMax system provides easy access to water with its protective pouch, expandable water bladder, tubing and biting valves. The system mounts on any shoulder pads and holds 16 ounces of water. Chris has a young football player with him to demonstrate how easy it is to pull the tube up to his mouth and drink. Chris is passionate about his product, because there are children d

products.name: Ecomower
products.description: UPDATE: Ecomower is no longer in business.

products.name: Games2U – Mobile Entertainment
products.description: Games2U is a national mobile entertainment company brings games, activities, and robots to your doorstep including Video Game Theaters and 4D Ride Experiences; high-tech Laser Tag; giant-sized, kid-driven U-Bots; life-size Hamster Balls and so much more.

products.name: Caddyswag
products.description: A great way to sneak beer onto the golf course, and other places for that matter.  This insulated bag comes with a reusable gel pack and carries six cans. No more waiting for the beverage cart girl and no more paying for overpriced beverages on the course.

products.name: SweepEasy – Broom and Scraper
products.description: The new and improved SweepEasy broom is finally here in 2017. SweepEasy is ready to help you clean your floors like never before! Gone are the days of getting down on your hands and knees to remove things like glue, gum, stickers, tape, food, or mystery gunk stuck to your hard flooring surfaces. With the 2 in 1 SweepEasy featuring a built in retractable scraper, you simply extend the scraper and scrape, sweep and go.

products.name: Daisy Cakes – Mail Order Cake
products.description: Daisy Cakes are southern style mail order cakes based on family recipes that have been passed down for generations. They are made from all natural ingredients and contain no preservatives. Available in many flavors including carrot, red velvet, chocolate, lemon, and coconut. The creator of Daisy Cakes went into the Shark Tank asking for $50k for a 25% share of the company. The Sharks loved the product, and several said they were the best cake they have ever tasted. Barbara couldn’t resist invest

products.name: Hot Mama Gowns
products.description: Hot Mama Gowns secured an investment from Barbara Corcoran, however the deal fell apart after the show aired. The product has been discontinued and the company is no longer in business.

products.name: Thin Gloss
products.description: April Morris hated being called “chubby.” She tried diet pills, but could not live with the side effects. Her “Aha!” moment came while she was applying lip gloss. Maybe an herb or a scent in lip gloss could help women lose weight. April did her research and discovered that Hoodia, a cactus-like plant that grows in Africa’s Kalahari Desert, had been used as an appetite suppressant. She then found particular aromas that improve mood and increase energy. To be able to fund this product, April went

products.name: Clip N Go by New Era Brands
products.description: Bob Kroupa created small containers filled with sugar-free mints or gum that clip onto backpacks, purses, overnight cases or anything that keeps them handy so that you can freshen your breath wherever you are. He had recently produced a Clip N Go case for contact lenses that was not yet on the market and planned to produce cases for vitamins and antioxidants.

products.name: Power Decal – Light Up Stickers
products.description: People love to support their organization or cause with a bumper sticker or medallion. These types of items are available in gift shops and stores around the world. Anyone who is a fan of anything probably has a bumper sticker to show it. That makes it hard for the real fans to stand out. With everyone and their dog displaying a bumper sticker, how do you prove that you’re a hardcore fan? You need a PowerDecal.

products.name: Fridge Fronts Appliance Cover
products.description: Have a tired old refrigerator? Is the outside dirty, scratched or otherwise “well loved”? Maybe it’s in perfectly good shape; it just doesn’t match the rest of your appliances. Don’t spend thousands of dollars replacing a perfectly good refrigerator.  Give it a cosmetic makeover with FridgeFronts.

products.name: Uncle Zip’s Beef Jerky
products.description: Uncle Zip’s Beef Jerky is all natural, fresh tasting beef jerky with no additives or preservatives, inspired from an old family recipe. Most commercial beef jerky is full of chemicals that allow it to sit on the shelf for years and also gives the jerky a tough texture. You haven’t really had beff jerky until you had it fresh, the difference is night and day. Ken Howell went into the Shark Tank asking for $25k for 20% of his company. The sharks enjoyed the product but did not invest.

products.name: Hillbilly Brand
products.description: Hillbilly Brand is a country lifestyle clothing brand with products ranging from t-shirts to hunting gear. The creators of Hillbilly Brand went into the Shark Tank asking for $50k for a 25% share of the company, but in the end they took a deal with Robert, Jeff, and Daymond, giving up 100% of the company for $75k and a 7% royalty.

products.name: Broccoli Wad
products.description: UPDATE: After the show aired, the deal with Broccoli Wad fell through. The product has been discontinued.

products.name: Ride-On Carry-On – Child Seat Meets Luggage
products.description: Air travel is stressful. Did we pack everything we need? Is there anything in my carry-on that’s going to give me a headache with security? Is the hotel reservation set? Did we remember our tickets? Are we going to make it to our gate on time? When you add a toddler into the mix, it amplifies the stress and the amount of work by 10.

products.name: Fitness Stride Resistance Bands
products.description: When Stacy Erwin was in college, he had trouble fitting his exercise regimen into his busy schedule. He needed a simple, inexpensive way to exercise every day. His solution was Fitness Stride: two straps that attach around each leg with resistance bands. The bands between the straps stretch as you walk, clean the house, mow the lawn—even as you sit at a desk.

products.name: Mod Mom – Furniture and Toy Boxes
products.description: Founder, Kiersten Hathcock, went from corporate to carpentry in 2006 and found international success with her line of modern kids furniture.  She appeared on Shark Tank in 2011 and has been featured on many TV shows, magazines, and international design books.

products.name: Pure Ayre
products.description: A safe and natural odor eliminator with a secret recipe that breaks up the offending molecules rather than masking the smell, all while being friendly to the environment. Not enough? It also removes stains. Pure Ayre can be used on draperies, furniture, carpets, bathrooms, closets, kitchens, laundry, cooking odors, cigarette smoke, shoes, cars, mold and mildew odors, and much more.

products.name: Flipoutz – Customizable and Trackable Bracelets
products.description: A combination of a collectable and a game, Flipoutz allows kids to trade personalized inserts called coins and track where they end up in an online community. While they did not secure an investment on Shark Tank, they did go on to have some success after the show and were even available at Walmart for a period of time. However, the product has been discontinued, their website is gone, and the company has been inactive for several years.

products.name: Vurtego Pogo Sticks
products.description: The world of extreme sports has a new entrant, extreme pogo. Extreme pogo sticks aren’t anything like the little toy you had growing up. These pogo sticks use space-age technology to launch riders as high as 10 feet into the air.

products.name: Wake n’ Bacon – Bacon Cooking Alarm Clock
products.description: Wake n’ Bacon was a prototype alarm clock pitched by Matty Sallin in 2011. Unfortunately, this product is nowhere to be found today. The idea was simple: put a few piece of pre-cooked bacon in the alarm clock when you go to bed, then the clock would automatically start reheating it 10 minutes before your set wake-up time. While this idea is heavenly for some, it is commonly called one of the worst pitches in Shark Tank history.

products.name: First Defense Nasal Screens
products.description: Do you struggle with allergies? Have you ever dealt with the irritation in your respiratory system that comes from working in the yard, the attic, cleaning the house or any other place where there are small particles floating in the air? These little particles aren’t just irritating; they are also associated with issues such as asthma, pulmonary disease, chronic bronchitis and even heart disease.

products.name: Toygaroo – Rental Service for Toys
products.description: Toygaroo was a rental service for toys, like Netflix is for DVDs. After your children tire of a toy, it was sent back and replaced with a different one. Although Toygaroo got a deal with Mark Cuban, there were problems with its business model and the company declared bankruptcy in 2012.

products.name: Copa Di Vino
products.description: Copa Di Vino appeared on Shark Tank in Season 2, and returned again in Season 3.

products.name: Wurking Stiffs Magnetic Collar Stay
products.description: The world’s first magnetic collar stay to tame those wild dog eared collars. Würkin Stiffs founder Jon Boos came up with the idea when he was tired of fighting his uncontrollable collar. He resorted to inserting a paper clip in his collar and kept it in place with a disc magnet. They also make travel toiletry bags, wallets, and everyday essentials for the Würkin man.

products.name: Tippi Toes – Children’s Dance Songs
products.description: Tippi Toes Dance Company cheerfully provides children with a fun, positive and nurturing environment so they are able to experience the joys of dance, self-expression and movement. Classes are specifically designed to develop motor skills and body awareness while enhancing each child’s self-esteem. Tippi Toes will get your kids movin and groovin.

products.name: The Original Shrimp Burger
products.description: The Shrimp Burger is a delicious and nutritious hamburger alternative that comes in several flavors including Teriyaki, Cajun, Jalapeño, and Original. CBS Foods also makes a Lobster Slider. The creator of The Original Shrimp Burger went into the Shark Tank asking for $200k for a 25% share of the company. The Sharks weren’t ready to invest in these products, but CBS Foods had a boom in sales after the show.

products.name: Remyxx Recyclable Sneakers (ReKixx)
products.description: Gary Gagnon saw old sneakers tossed into the trash and was inspired: Why not recycle sneakers? Why not make them from recycled materials? ReMyxx (“Sneakers with a Purpose”) are durable, stylish and comfortable and come in bright, pretty colors and clever designs to appeal to all tastes, ages and genders. They are manufactured with a special blend of lab-certified recyclable materials that look and feel like canvas and rubber. They also are stamped on the uppers and soles with the recycle insigni

products.name: UniKey – Bluetooth Enabled Deadbolt Lock
products.description: UPDATE: UniKey has rebranded and created a new product line called Kwikset

products.name: Nitroforce Home Gym
products.description: High pressure nitrogen gas springs provide resistance in this versatile strength training machine. Over 100 exercise variations can be performed in four modes. From basic exercises for the beginners, to complex full body movements for pro athletes, the TITAN has pushing and pulling forces with angles that no other piece of exercise equipment can duplicate.

products.name: Cougar Energy Drinks
products.description: *The company website is no longer available. This product may be discontinued.

products.name: Mix Bikini
products.entrepreneur: who never appeared on the show
products.description: Frank Scozzafava and Adam DiSilvestro pitched their mix-and-match swimsuits. Buy separate pieces (left and right tops, front and back bottoms) that are reversible and come in many colors and patterns and you have many swimsuits. It’s likely that you will have your own unique swimsuit. Two young women modeled the suits, and Frank demonstrated on the website how users select the pieces. They wanted to have Mix Bikini kiosks in shopping malls. They had only done a “soft launch,” so sales were scant

products.name: Squirrel Nut Butter
products.description: Wild Squirrel Nut Butters was rebranded as Wild Friends after appearing on Shark Tank.

products.name: Cab20 – Rock Band
products.description: Cab20 was the only rock band to appear on Shark Tank. While the sharks enjoyed their performance, they didn’t see a strong business opportunity and declined to make an offer. Cab20 is no longer active.

products.name: Billy Blanks Jr.’s Dance With Me
products.description: Billy Blanks Jr., son of the creator of Tae Bo, brings you an intense and easy to follow dance workout. Billy went into the Shark Tank seeking $100k for a 20% share of the company. Mark and Daymond reached a deal for a higher 50% equity. Dance With Me videos are available on Amazon.

products.name: SkyRide
products.description: SkyRide is an elevated human-powered monorail system invented by Scott Olson. Users sit in a capsule suspended from a rail and pedal or row, depending on which model being used. Scott created it for fitness, recreation and transportation. It’s accessible to people of all ages and all physical abilities—there is an Electric Assist when needed. Also, it can be used in any weather, day or night, and the flexible track can be configured for any landscape. Scott envisions SkyClubs with a pay-as-you-g

products.name: Boot Illusions
products.description: Boot Illusions creators and business partners, Queenie Davis and Andrew Goodrum, introduced the leather and fabric “uppers” that slip over conventional high heels to turn them into fabulous boots. And you can switch from shoes to boots and back again in a matter of minutes. Simply zip the Illusions on and zip them off. Queenie and Andrew had only reached the prototype phase, but they had a manufacturer in Turkey ready to go. They were looking for help with retail distribution.

products.name: Villy Custom Bicycles
products.description: In 2006 Fleetwood Hicks discovered beach cruiser bikes on Venice Beach while in Los Angeles on a business trip. After renting a beach cruiser for a scheduled one-hour ride, he brought the rental back 6 hours later and was hooked; relishing the simplicity, comfort and style of the bike and the fact that you could wear street clothes and look stylish riding.

products.name: Nail Pak Nail Polish Kits
products.description: Barbara Lampugnale and her six daughters enjoyed getting together for “nail night.” The problem was gathering all the products that ended up in a jumble. So Barbara created a product that contained all of the items needed in one package: nail polish, pre-soaked remover pads and a file. She called her product “Nail Pak” and founded her company, Duality Cosmetics, that she was able to finance herself. She was looking for an investment, because distribution had suffered as she spent her time applyi

products.name: Sullivan Generator
products.description: The Sullivan Generator is a conceptual machine by inventor Mark Sullivan. Mark went into the Shark Tank with his patents and drawings and asked for $1 million for 10% equity in his idea, but failed to make the impression he was hoping for. Sullivan claimed his generator, if built, would use the Coriolis effect caused by the Earth’s rotation to create electricity from salt water, or industrial waste water. The water would undergo a desalination process where it is turned to steam. Sullivan says t

products.name: Blondie’s Cookies
products.description: It all began on the campus of Indiana State University in 1984. Brenda Coffman, a business student, began a small business from her Married Student Housing apartment called the Cookie Cabin. Her primary customers were students and faculty at both ISU and Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology where her husband attended. In January of 1985, Brenda began negotiating for the first retail store with the Simon Property Group who are the largest mall developers in the country and the owners of the Markla

products.name: Copa Di Vino (2nd appearance)
products.description: Copa Di Vino appeared on Shark Tank in Season 2, and returned again in Season 3.

products.name: AirBedz Truck Mattress
products.description: Take a comfortable mattress anywhere you go with AirBedz, the original truck bed air mattress. AirBedz are custom designed air mattresses specifically made to fit in the beds pickup trucks. The sides of the mattress have cutouts which allows it go around and over the wheel wells, creating a sleep area that uses the whole bed of the truck.

products.name: ScotteVest Technology Enabled Clothing
products.description: If you’re into your gadgets you know it can be a pain to carry all those devices around. You’ve got your phone, your tablet, your digital camera, your laptop, and all the headsets and gizmos that go along with them. TEC, or Technology Enabled Clothing, lets you carry and access all these devices easily from hidden pockets in the lining of the clothing. TEC hides wires and makes it simple to stay plugged in when you’re on the move.

products.name: The Ave Custom Printed Apparel
products.description: Nick Romero, from Venice Beach, California, pitched his company, Ave Venice, a custom printing shop for clothing and sneakers. He bought a shirt-printing machine and spent two years modifying it and designing software so that he could print custom artwork on sneakers. The patent-pending plate that holds the sneakers in place is his “secret sauce.” Customers bring in their own artwork or choose from the designs that Nick has available and have their clothing or sneakers printed while they wait. N

products.name: Brewer’s Cow Ice Cream
products.description: Steve Albert, Larry Blackwell and Jason Conroy brought Brewer’s Cow Ice Cream to the Tank. Steve had been creating unique premium ice cream recipes for years and found a way to add beer flavoring to the ice cream. A woman dressed as a German barmaid handed out samples, and the sharks were really impressed, except for Daymond who didn’t touch his sample. He’s lactose intolerant and, therefore, not interested in the ice cream business. Mark shared that he also is lactose intolerant but didn’t care

products.name: Tower Paddle Boards
products.description: Stand up paddle boarding is a fun way to relax and play at the lake or the beach. Add a little bit of intensity and it delivers an incredible full-body workout. Paddle boarding is causing many to step out of the gym and into the water to get their workout.

products.name: Readerest Clip For Glasses
products.description: Eyeglasses are expensive. At an average of $300 a pair no one can afford to lose or damage their eyewear.  Yet if you’re like most people, you don’t wear your glasses all the time.  Therein lies a problem – what to do with your glasses when they’re not on your face? You can hang them on the neck of your shirt but they slide to the floor as soon as you bend over.  Tuck them into your dress pocket and they fall out and disappear. Perch them on the top of your head and you forget where you put them

products.name: Nardo’s Natural Organic Skin Care
products.description: Nardo’s Natural is a line of all natural, organic skin care products developed by four brothers. These are high quality products used in spas but also available online so you can experience the spa in the comfort of your own home. Nardo’s Natural skin care products are good for all skin types and are loaded with nutrients. The creators of Nardo’s Natural went into the Shark Tank asking for $75k for 12% of their company. Barbara offered to come in for a much higher 50% of the business, which was

products.name: You Smell Soap
products.description: You Smell is a vibrant luxury soap brand made with organic ingredients, that is a breath of fresh air in an often snooty marketplace. This self-indulgent, moisturizing, vitamin infused soap is available in fragrances like Lemon Verbena and Lavender Mint. They also make a paper wipe for freshening up on the go.

products.name: Talbott Teas
products.description: For the founders of Talbott Tea, Shane Talbott and Steve Nakisher, the belief that having tea should be a pampering experience runs deep. Talbott’s unique experience in the spa and salon industry has given him an incredible attention to the details, as is clear from the recipes for these Oprah Winfrey-backed tea leaves. Now available at Jamba Juice, Talbott Teas offer brilliant, bold flavors and deep drinking luxury.

products.name: Skinnies Instant Lifts
products.description: Find an instant solution to banishing that unsightly cellulite. Skinnies are clear skin adhesives that provide dramatic smoothing and lifting results. They’re incredibly easy to apply and can be worn all day with no discomfort. Just remove them when you’re done, and that’s it!

products.name: GoGo Gear Motorcycle Riding Apparel
products.description: In 2009, Arlene Battishill saw a gap in the growing Los Angeles motorcycle scene. Women who rode bikes and scooters were looking for gear that made them look as awesome as they felt, but weren’t finding options that fit their shapes–or budget. Using her corporate and educational experience to back her, Battishill launched GoGoGear in an effort to fill the need.

products.name: The Heat Helper – Dryer Attachment that Saves Money
products.description: The Heat Helper is an amazingly simple device that saves energy and money. It catches, filters, and redirects the hot air required for drying your clothes, which is normally sent through a vent outdoors. Instead of  wasting that energy, that hot air can be used to heat your home in the winter. The Heat Helper pays for itself in lower heating bills in the first year. The creator of The Heat Helper went into the Shark Tank asking for $100k for a 50% share of the company. The sharks loved Lyle, the

products.name: The Smart Baker – Innovative Kitchen Tools
products.description: Home baking has never been more popular than it is today. More and more people are getting back into the kitchen and making things from scratch to help them save money. The Smart Baker has created innovative tools to make baking easy and fun, like The Cheat Sheet Apron which helps you scale down recipes that call for amounts too large for just 1 or 2 people.

products.name: Lollacup Sippy Cups
products.description: Pediatricians recommend using straw cups rather than traditional sippy cups because of the speech and dental benefits of using straws. Most cups for toddlers have spill-proof valves which make them incredibly hard to drink from and frustrating to clean. Toddlers can struggle with straw cups because they only work well when held upright. Lollacup eliminates these challenges by incorporating a flexible straw with a weighted end that keeps the bottom of the straw in the liquid. This means your chil

products.name: The Painted Pretzel
products.description: These wildly popular gourmet pretzels are available in unlimited flavor combinations! Painted Pretzels are coated in many types of chocolate including white, dark, milk, butterscotch, peanut butter and mint. As if that wasn’t delicious enough, they are then topped with treats like candy bars, nuts and even fruit. The sharks loved these delectable snacks and Mark Cuban took the exact deal the entrepreneur asked for – $100k for 25% equity. Check out the Painted Pretzel website to order.

products.name: Clean Bottle
products.description: Pretty much everyone has a reusable water bottle these days and that’s great. You don’t have to spend a fortune on bottled water and it’s the right thing to do for the environment. But most of these bottles all have one frustrating problem – you can’t get to the bottom of them to clean them out. Heavily used bottles can get so dirty and disgusting they look like a science experiment gone wrong.  Now there’s a better design from Clean Bottle, the worlds only bottle that unscrews from the bottom a

products.name: Invis-A-Rack
products.description: The Invis-A-Rack Cargo Management System allows you to have a functional ladder rack that can be collapsed down into the bed rail casings when not in use. Whether you have the need to haul the occasional load from the home improvement store, or depend on a cargo system daily- you can trust the Invis-A-Rack by Dee Zee to be up to the challenge. While it is lightweight and easy to handle, it has an impressive 500 lb capacity.

products.name: Liquid Money – Money Scented Perfume and Cologne
products.description: The sense of smell is a powerful trigger for a range of emotions and sensations. There is one smell in particular that has uniquely intoxicating effect – the smell of money. Liquid Money is the the scent of money in a bottle, so now you can proudly wear the sweet smell of success. This bold fragrance is available in two scents, His Money and Her Money. You’ll smell like a million bucks! The creator of Liquid Money went into the Shark Tank asking for $100k for a 5% share of the company. While the

products.name: Kisstixx Lip Balm
products.description: Studies show kissing helps reduce blood pressure, lessens cramps and headaches, fights cavities, boosts self esteem. Make sure your lips are kissable with Kisstixx, a lip balm made with kissing in mind. Kisstixx is a high-quality lip balm that comes packaged in two compatible flavors – one for you and one for your partner. When you kiss, the amazing flavors combine creating a chemistry that’s bursting with flavors and aromas. There are several delicious combinations available including Strawberr

products.name: Viewsport Sweat Activated Workout Gear
products.description: ViewSPORT is an innovative fitness apparel line focused on the motivated athlete, sports teams, the military, and others looking to get the most from their fitness and training efforts. When an athlete exercises, the patent-pending ViewSPORT sweat activated technology reveals a design that is only apparent once sweat comes in contact with the fabric. The harder the wearer works, the more visible the image.

products.name: The Last Lid
products.description: Update: The Last Lid website is no longer available. This product is discontinued.

products.name: Debbie Brooks Handbags and Accesories
products.description: Debbie Brooks is a one-of-a-kind handbag and accessory line. It was created by its namesake who made the successful transition from artist to fashion designer. Debbie Brooks hand bags are famous for their personalized plates and skins. It’sa signature that has crossed over to clutches, phone cases, and even belt buckles. The items are so distinct that they’ve become a favorite among Hollywood stars such as Sarah Jessica Parker, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Nicole Kidman.

products.name: Vinamor Wine Aerator
products.description: Gary DeJohn invented the Vinamor, a wine aerator. Sit the Vinamor in the top of any wine glass. Pour wine into it so that it travels down a glass tube to a sphere, which exposes every angle of the wine to the air, so that it can breathe. The Vinamor softens the tannins, allows the desired flavors to flourish, and prevents any possible sediment or particles from reaching your glass. The wine can be enjoyed immediately compared to the traditional manner of aerating wine: emptying the contents of a

products.name: Jones Scones
products.description: Jones Scones was a line of all-natural traditional British cream scones created by J Jones of Denver, Colorado. J returned to the US to attend law school at George Washington University. He had been living in the UK and was distressed when he was unable to find proper British scones here. He learned to make them himself, because he loved those scones; and it didn’t hurt that the ladies were very impressed with his baking skills.

products.name: Tom and Chee Grilled Cheese
products.description: Trew Quackenbush and Corey Ward founded Tom & Chee as a gourmet grilled cheese shop in a tent in downtown Cincinnati. Trew is a self-taught cook and Corey grew up behind the grill at his parents’ ice cream shop. The two wanted to serve comfort food, tomato soup and grilled cheese, in a casual dining environment. The lines wound round the block for the 10–15 varieties of grilled cheese (half a sandwich, full sandwich, or double-decker) plus a build-your-own option and their signature grilled chee

products.name: Geek Chic Gaming Furniture
products.description: Robert Gifford made custom, heirloom-quality gaming tables for the discerning gamer/geek who cares about aesthetics. He  could accommodate any customer’s gaming interests and style. The wooden tabletops that doubled as dining tables were made of the finest cherry, maple or walnut and slid open to reveal a polished surface tailored to the desires of the individual customers, regardless if they wanted a table for card games, board games, or any other kind of game, or the drawer that transforms int

products.name: Stella Valle Jewelry
products.description: Stella Valle is a jewelry line that encourages individuality and self expression. The style is a marriage of masculine and feminine characteristics. Stalla Valle was inspired by and designed for strong, creative women, who chart their own path, lead their own lives, and create their own history. The creators of  went into the Shark Tank asking for $150k for a 25% share of the company. Lori and Mark teamed hop for a higher 35% equity, a proposal which was happily accepted.

products.name: Track Days Racing Movie
products.description: James LaVitola was a stuntman on Fast and Furious and Friday Night Lights, among many other films. Brian Pitt was a producer of several “successful enough” indie films. The two had come up with a guaranteed blockbuster, a movie about motorcycle racing. There had never been a movie about motorcycle racing and (they said) it is the second most watched sport in the US. All they needed was $5,000,000 to bring it to theaters near you.

products.name: Baby’s Bad Ass Burgers
products.description: Baby’s Badass Burgers sprang from the imaginations and experiences of ex-New Yorker restaurateur Erica Cohen and celebrated event planner Lori Barbera. Cohen launched her career in the restaurant world as one of the founding partners in the first of The ONE Group’s many restaurants. Cohen, a passionate foodie and burgermeister at heart who had “been searching for the perfect, quintessential cheeseburger since she was a little girl,” decided that in order to satiate her quest she would have to cr

products.name: Mee-Ma’s Gumbo Brick
products.description: Carol Foster, single mom and former truck driver from Louisiana, served her grandmother’s gumbo in her restaurant. Unfortunately, heavy rains brought the ceiling of the restaurant down, and Carol decided to sell the Gumbo Brick online. The Gumbo Brick is a frozen block of all the makings for authentic Louisiana style gumbo. Just add water, three to four pounds of sausage and shrimp, and in less than 45 minutes, you have gumbo for six to eight people. Lori made an offer, and Kevin joined in once

products.name: nPower PEG – Human Generated Electricity
products.description: The nPower PEG by Tremont Electric was presented as the world’s first human powered charger for your devices. It made use of the kinetic energy you create as you walk, run, bike, or move around, giving you 100% green electricity whenever you need it. The creators of The nPower PEG went into the Shark Tank asking for $2 million for a 22% share of the company. The sharks were impressed with the product and saw its potential, but did not invest.

products.name: KaZAM Bikes – Balance Bicycle with No Pedals
products.description: KaZAM is at the forefront of the balance bike revolution. If you have a child between the ages of 2 ½- to 5 ½ years old, KaZAM is the perfect alternative to training wheels. The bike takes the focus off peddling, and places it on steering and balance. It’s a method that’s been used in Europe for years, and the KaZAM founders have brought it to the United States. It’s one of the easiest and safest ways to teach children how to ride.

products.name: Mistobox – Coffee Subscription Service
products.description: Mistobox is a coffee subscription service that gives coffee lovers the opportunity to have their own personalized coffee delivered right to their doorstep. When you sign up for an account at Mistobox, you will be asked to fill out a short questionnaire that determines your coffee preferences. For example, it will ask about your coffee roasting preferences; bold, light or somewhere in the middle. Then it will go on to ask you a more fun questions like whether you enjoy trying new coffee or if you

products.name: Vermont Butcher Blocks
products.description: Wooden utensils, bowls, platters and accessories are both durable and beautiful. The Vermont Butcher Block & Board Company produces some of the best looking and highest quality wooden kitchenware available.

products.name: Wicked Good Cupcakes in a Jar
products.description: Tracey Noonan’s youngest child, Danielle, was “launching,” moving out of the family home, and Tracey wanted to make sure they continued to do things together. When she saw cake-decorating classes offered, she thought, “Perfect!” More perfect than she ever dreamed.

products.name: Mission Belt – Ratcheting Belt Buckle
products.description: A belt is a belt right? It’s long, thin and it keeps your pants up. Often, it also lacks fashion appeal. The Mission Belt Co. has found a way to turn the utilitarian into art. The Mission Belt isn’t like a traditional belt – a strip of plain leather with some holes. It’s a solid piece of high-quality leather with a one-of-a-kind buckle that doesn’t require belt notches. No notches mean a better fit and a belt that looks great and lasts longer.

products.name: LiddUp Cooler With Lights
products.description: Jason Sandberg and Taylor Gwizadon are the founders of LiddUp Coolers and produce the first and only cooler with built-in LED lighting so you can find items in the dark. Jason came up with the idea one night when he was at a family cookout. He wanted an ice cold beer, so he went to the cooler and began to slosh around looking for a can. He found one, but it was a soda can. That’s when he wondered why there couldn’t be lights in the cooler. He and Taylor built the first prototypes of the LiddUp a

products.name: CordaRoys Convertible Beanbag Chairs
products.description: Say goodbye to airbeds! Now there’s a new sheriff in town called CordaRoys. Founded in 1998, CordaRoys sells patented, foam-filled beanbags that convert to beds. Yes, a round beanbag that converts to a rectangular bed! As a chair it’s the most comfortable thing you’ll ever experience – imagine sitting on a cloud but with more support! Then, simply remove the outer cover to reveal a standard size foam mattress that will last a lifetime and NEVER go flat!

products.name: Simple Sugars Skin Care Products
products.description: Lani Lazzari was only 11 years old when she developed Simple Sugars, handmade all-natural skincare products especially formulated for sensitive skin. The body, facial and foot scrubs cleanse, exfoliate and moisturize in one easy step.

products.name: RootSuit Spandex Body Suit
products.description: RootSuit is the original seller of full body spandex suits that are perfect for sporting events, parties, Halloween, and other events. Founded in 2008, RootSuit’s product has grown in popularity, allowing people to show their fandom and have fun. The suits are made of high quality, strong material so you can wear them again and again

products.name: Shell Bobbers – Shotgun Shell Fishing Bobbers
products.description: This shotgun shell fishing bobber is a real blast. It’s a truly unique bobber made from a real 12 gauge shotgun shell and it makes a perfect gift for anyone who likes to hunt or fish. The creators of Shell Bobbers went into the Shark Tank asking for $80k for a 20% share of the company. There were several offers but in the end, Mark reaches a deal for a higher 33% equity.

products.name: Psi Bands Acupressure Wristbands
products.description: PsiBands wristbands relieve nausea by pushing on pressure points located above the wrists. Acupressure has been used for centuries in the Eastern world, and is gaining recognition worldwide as an effective drug-free method for managing nausea caused by morning sickness, motion sickness, anesthesia, and chemotherapy. PsiBands feature a pressure dial with 51 different setting so you can fine tune to find the perfect fit.

products.name: Gobie H2O – Filtered Water Bottle
products.description: Water is the most vital resource on the planet and always having fresh, clean drinking water is essential. The Gobie water bottle with built-in filter is designed to be tough, ergonomic, and to eliminate harmful and bad tasting elements from tap water.

products.name: Squirrel Boss Bird Feeder
products.description: You’ve probably never considered your backyard a battleground, unless you have bird feeders. You put the bird feeders out to attract beautiful birds to your backyard and give Mother Nature a little helping hand. You don’t want those little birds to go hungry, do you?

products.name: Green Garmento – EcoFriendly Laundry Bag
products.description: Did you know the federal government warns consumers not to leave plastic bags on garments from dry cleaners due to health concerns? In addition, over 15 countries around the world have banned, restricted, or taxed single-use plastic bags, including the United States. Every year, over 300 million pounds of plastic bags are tossed in landfills, and enough plastic is thrown out to circle the globe a staggering four times!

products.name: Grinds Coffee Pouches
products.description: Grinds Coffee Pouches are a healthy alternative to chewing tobacco that also provide a powerful energy boost. They’re small pouches of flavored coffee loaded with Taurine and Guarana, the same active ingredients in 5 Hour Energy drinks. Just place a Grinds pouch in your mouth and you’ll get a caffeine rush like coffee as well as B-Vitamins and other energy boosting nutrients. It’s raw energy ready when you need it. Watch the video below to hear the inspiration behind the product.

products.name: Nuts n More High Protein Spreads
products.description: Nut ’N More is a line of healthy, premium nut butters fortified with added protein, flax, and omegas. They are high in fiber, contain no added sugar, and have double the protein of your regular peanut butter. Flavors include Almond Butter, Chocolate, Almond, Chocolate Peanut, Cinnamon Raisin, Toffee Crunch, White Chocolate, Classic Peanut Butter, and Sesame Cranbutter.

products.name: Neo Innovations Tattoo Removal
products.description:
Update from Neo Innovations founder: 
The Neo Innovations IPL Tattoo Removal Model featured on Shark Tank was an older complicated design.  However, our new IPL Tattoo Removal Model is easier to use, more effective and reliable. It features a rechargeable lithium ion battery and includes our patent pending Neodymium magnetic tip. The Neodymium Magnet tip draws the magnetic tattoo ink to the surface of the skin. This maximizes the effectiveness of each treatment.

products.name: Echo Valley Meats
products.entrepreneur: in the show’s history to pitch the same business successfully the second time around
products.description: Echo Valley Meats appeared on Shark Tank twice. In season 4 they failed to secure an investment but were invited back in season 6 and made a deal with Mark Cuban.

products.name: CoolWraps Gift Wrap
products.description: Jeffrey Miller designed CoolWraps for people who don’t have a flair for gift wrapping. Instead of a table filled with rolls of paper, scissors and tape, there is only the CoolWraps bag. Slide the gift in, remove the protective film from the adhesive strip, fold it over and seal it, just as you would an envelope. Then you blast it with a hair dryer and see the bag shrink to a wrinkle-free, snugly wrapped gift—no matter how odd the shape of the gift.

products.name: Traditional Fisheries Lionfish
products.description: Dave Johnson and Gary Groomes were the founders of Traditional Fisheries, a seafood distributing company. They were concerned about the growing population of lionfish in the Atlantic Ocean. The lionfish was first imported from the Pacific Ocean and sold in tropical fish stores. About 20 years ago, someone tossed a handful of them into the Atlantic Ocean, and they multiplied like rabbits. They have no natural predators due to the venomous spines on their bodies. They are the predators and wreak h

products.name: Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler
products.description: Marc Newburger and Jeffrey Simon were scraping by in Hollywood, filmmakers waiting for their big break. Marc was crashing on Jeffrey’s couch; Jeffrey was still driving his mother’s hand-me-down car. They supported themselves by working as nutrition counselors, and Jeffrey made extra money playing poker in Las Vegas.

products.name: HoodiePillow – A Pillow With a Hood
products.description: Sometimes you just need to shut out the world and relax. Whether you need to de-stress or you just need to take a quick power nap, getting that rest during the day can be difficult. Even if you manage to fall asleep with the sun streaming through the window, you simply don’t sleep as well as you would in the dark. You need a way to block out the light, muffle sound and keep you nice and cozy.

products.name: Xero Shoes Barefootware
products.description: Imagine walking and running in shoes that are so minimal, it’s almost like wearing nothing at all. This is the kind of comfort that Xero Shoes offer. These thin rubber sandals, inspired by the tire sandals of the Tarahumara Indians, are designed to be the ultimate natural walking experience and come with a 5,000 mile warranty. Purchase these shoes as a DIY kit and create a barefoot sandal that’s a perfect fit for your foot, or pick a pair that’s pre-fitted for you. Their lightweight design makes

products.name: Lose 12 Inches With Any 12 Workouts
products.description: High-energy Ryan Ehmann came into the Tank like the rootin’ tootin’ cowboy he is. Fourteen years on the rodeo circuit left him with chronic lower back pain, and he had been told by every doctor he saw that he would never ride again. Not willing to accept that, he devised his own workout program, got back in the saddle again, and won a national rodeo title. He was on Shark Tank pitching his 12-step program that he was sure could help anyone get into shape in less time than other workouts. He also

products.name: Cell Helmet Phone Cases
products.description: Cellhelmet is a mobile accessories manufacturer and distributor headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania with a satellite office in Shenzhen, China. Cellhelmet was founded in 2012 and appeared on Shark Tank on March 8, 2013. Cellhelmet is a registered trademark of Kane and McHenry Enterprises, LLC.

While biking through the Rocky Mountains, Mike got in the habit of jumping into every cold lake or river he came across. The more he jumped, the better he felt—until he could no longer wait until he was in the mountains for his “fix.” Cold plunge tubs were prohibitively expensive,

At a food convention, he saw cuisines from cultures around the world—but not from Korea. He did not like that people were missing out on knowing how flavorful Korean food is and on learning about the colorful culture. Not long after the convention, he attended a meeting at the University of Utah, and that was the first time he had ever seen food trucks. It didn’t take him long

products.name: Browndages Skin Tone Bandages
products.description: For most of the past 100 years the leading bandage companies marketed their products as “flesh toned.” However, the bandages were all pale pink or tan, ignoring the fact that human beings have flesh in a vast range of colors.

products.description: Mindy and Brandon Wright’s daughter, Ruby, apparently decided she wanted no part of the potty. They tried every technique in the books, but the more they tried, the more Ruby dug in her heels. If only they could find a fun way to toilet train her. One day, Brandon remembered how much fun he had with Advent calendars when he was young: counting down each day until Christmas, using stickers to decorate the calendar, opening the door or drawer to find the secret gift. Could they create a mash-up of

Tony was an amateur barber before he was a professional engineer. His mother cut his hair when he was growing up, so when he went to college, he cut it himself. He did such a good job that his friends had him cut their hair. All went well as long as he could use clippers to shape a buzz cut. When he decided to go with

products.name: BusyBox Do Not Disturb Sign
products.description: Busybox is a wireless status box that helps you work uninterrupted at home. Busybox lets you create and display your own custom messages to say leave me alone however you want to. Slide in a choice of six messages to tell everyone in the house not to bother you, or create your own message. Turn it on and get to work.

As a dancer, she knew very well the stress, strain, and frequent injuries to legs and feet that every dancer endures. products.name: Umaro Foods Seaweed-Based Bacon

He has a BFA degree in Graphic Design from Western Kentucky University and worked on video productions for Fortune 500 companies; planned economic development projects and community events; and produced, directed, and wrote Dirty Laundry, a documentary about cancer-causing asbestos. During her college years, Jasmine had been a varsity basketball player and assistant team coach. Not surprisingly, these two skills combined in June of 2020, when she founded her company, round21.

products.name: Young King Hair Care
products.description: Young King Hair Care is a line of natural, plant-based products that are made specifically for Black and Brown boys. From the ingredients to the scent to the packaging—it’s all geared to redefine male grooming and encourage boys with textured hair to celebrate their “crowns.”

products.name: ootBox Moveable Workspaces

products.name: Do Amore Jewelry

products.description: For many people, the beach is their happy place! Who doesn’t love sitting in the sun, feeling the soft sand beneath their feet, and hearing the laughter of children running into the surf? But sitting on most beach chairs? Not so comfortable!

What if there were a way to keep all the ingredients, bowls and utensils organized while cooking? What if the mess could be contained to one 21” wide space rather than strewn around the kitchen? What if clean-up could be done lickety-split? All those things are now possible—the Prepdeck is here!

products.name: Ade + Ayo Children’s Clothing

She worked as a lawyer for several years, but found that her heart really wasn’t in it. Adedokun knew that someday she would let her entrepreneur spirit free and create a business of her own. In the meantime, though, she kept working as a lawyer.

products.name: Behave Bras
products.description: “If you want something done right, sometimes you have to do it yourself.” Athena Kasvikis waited a long time for a lingerie company to design a bra for her and the 50+ million other women, in the US alone, who need DD to I cups but 30-38 bands.

products.name: Curie Deodorant & Skincare
products.description: Sarah Moret founded Curie because she was frustrated with natural products that didn’t work as well as the chemical-filled stuff.

products.name: Noggin Boss Hats
products.description: Sports fans wear their team’s jersey or their favorite player’s number. They paint their faces in the team colors, and there are the ubiquitous #1 foam fingers. Now there is a sure way to stand out from the crowd: The Noggin Boss, a hugely over-sized “baseball cap.” Be ready to appear on the Jumbotron or on national television.

products.name: Tucky Belt
products.description: Tucky is an undergarment accessory that has redefined the way people style their tops. The Tucky Belt helps you transform your shirts, hoodies, or sweaters into trendy crop tops or achieve the perfect tucked-in look without the unnecessary bulk.

products.name: Tones of Melanin Collegiate Wear

products.name: Eyewris Folding Reading Glasses
products.description: Founded by Mark Singer and Kenzo Singer, Eyewris offers a unique solution to a common problem faced by many people who require reading glasses: carrying them around all the time. The company has developed a foldable reading glass design that can be conveniently worn on the wrist, ensuring the glasses are always within reach when needed.

products.description: The world of social media influencers is often seen as glamorous, filled with travel, designer clothes, and luxurious experiences. However, a new board game called “Influencers in the Wild” aims to showcase the often bizarre and comical side of the industry. Developed by George “Tank” Resch, a social media star in his own right, the game provides a satirical look into the lives of influencers and their pursuit of internet fame.

products.name: Nature’s Wild Berry Miracle Berries
products.description: Nature has always been the ultimate source of natural remedies for mankind. Among the many hidden gems that nature has to offer, the Miracle Berry, also known as Ledidi Berries, stands out as one of the most unique and revolutionary discoveries in the field of taste manipulation.

products.name: Noshi Food Paint for Kids
products.description: As a parent, finding healthy and appealing food products for picky eaters can be a challenge. But with Noshi Food Paint, mealtime can become an exciting and interactive experience for kids. Noshi Food Paint is an organic, edible food paint designed for children to use on their meals. With three tubes of different colored organic fruit purees, kids can paint and decorate their pancakes, waffles, ice cream, oatmeal, yogurt, bagel and cream cheese, toast, crackers, and cupcakes.

products.name: See the Way I See Clothing
products.description: See the Way I See is a clothing brand that offers a range of clothing, jewelry, accessories, and stationary. The owner and creator of See the Way I See is Sophie Nistico, a recent college graduate who suffers from anxiety and chronic migraines. Sophie has created See the Way I See with the goal of destigmatizing mental health and bringing more awareness to the subject.

products.name: You Go Natural Hair Accessories for Textured Hair
products.description: You Go Natural (YGN) is a brand that has transformed the world of hair accessories for individuals with textured hair. Founded by Monique Little in 2016, YGN has come a long way from its humble beginnings in a living room to an 8,000 square foot production facility in East Dallas. The company is dedicated to creating functional and beautiful hair accessories that cater to the needs of those with textured hair, making styling and protection effortless and elegant.

products.name: Honey Bunchies Honey Bars
products.description: A family-owned business based in Longmont, Colorado, Honey Bunchies is the brainchild of Ed Payne, a former Captain in the United States Air Force. Ed, together with his wife Jennifer, daughter Kendra, and son Edward, has built a thriving business centered around the creation of their gourmet honey bars.

products.name: Dapper Boi Body-Inclusive Fashion
products.description: Dapper Boi is an innovative body-inclusive apparel line that aims to transform the world by changing the way people dress. Founded in 2015 by the dynamic married couple, Vicky and Charisse Pasche, this brand breaks the mold of traditional fashion by offering a wide range of sizes and styles to suit diverse body shapes and preferences.

products.name: Tia Lupita Foods
products.description: Founded by Hector Saldivar, Tia Lupita Foods is a brand that embodies the love, tradition, and flavors of Mexico, while also offering innovative and healthy products. Named in honor of Hector’s mother, Tia Lupita, the company’s products are based on cherished family recipes that have been passed down through generations.

After two years of rigorous research, development, and testing in various locations and conditions, The Ice Cream Canteen finally became a reality.
