products.description: Veba has created the world’s first smart bottle monitor that automatically tracks the expiration of breast milk and formula. Veba ensures that babies are getting the best nutrition possible, so that parents can focus their time and energy on what truly matters – their children.

products.name: Hibear Insulated Bottle
products.description: Mark Tsigounis, a U.S. Navy veteran and avid adventurer, founded Hibear after realizing the need for a versatile and sustainable insulated bottle during his travels and outdoor excursions. Tsigounis’ experience in the Navy taught him the value of multi-functional gear, as every item carried had to serve more than one purpose. This mindset inspired him to create the All-Day Adventure Flask, a unique insulated bottle designed to craft various beverages while also serving as an everyday water bottl

products.name: Nowhere Bakery Plant Based Cookies
products.description: Nowhere Bakery is an award-winning maker of indulgent, gut-friendly treats founded in 2020 by husband and wife team Saphira and Maurizio Rasti. The company was born out of Saphira’s personal struggles with gut issues and multiple food intolerances that made it difficult for her to find treats she could enjoy without adverse effects. At the same time, her husband Maurizio had an insatiable sweet tooth and wasn’t satisfied with traditional “healthy” cookies that tasted unpleasantly dry.

products.name: Nourish and Bloom Grocery and Bistro
products.description: Nourish + Bloom Market is an innovative grocery market and bistro that combines variety, convenience, and cutting-edge technology. Founded by Jamie Michael Hemmings and Jilea Hemmings, this pioneering establishment aims to make healthy eating accessible and hassle-free for everyone.

products.name: The Murder Mystery Co
products.description: The Murder Mystery Co. is an entertainment company that specializes in hosting interactive murder mystery events. Founded in 2002 in Grand Rapids, Michigan, the company has grown to become the largest theatrical company in the nation, offering over 7,500 shows annually across more than 20 troupes nationwide.

products.name: Boona Tandem Shower Heads
products.description: Brett Skaloud and Jeff Feiereisen are the co-founders behind Boona, a startup company based in Seattle, Washington that is shaking up the shower experience. The two entrepreneurs previously worked together at Amazon, where they were part of the founding teams for cutting-edge projects like the cashierless Amazon Go convenience stores. However, it was a casual conversation about shower habits that sparked the idea for their first product – the Tandem Shower.

products.name: Let Them Eat Candles Edible Candles
products.description: Let Them Eat Candles, the brainchild of Loree Sandler and her husband Bob Michelson, are handcrafted edible candles made from premium milk and dark chocolate, adding a luxurious and delightful touch to every occasion.

products.name: Chefee Robotic Chef
products.description: Founded in 2021 by Assaf Pashut, a seasoned entrepreneur and foodie, Chefee Robotics has created the world’s first embedded robotic chef, a compact device that can fit seamlessly into existing kitchen designs and cook hundreds of dishes from scratch.

products.name: The Lady Alpha Nursing Cover
products.description: In the sweltering Arizona heat, new mom Jackie Samuelson faced a frustrating challenge while breastfeeding her daughter Sunny – keeping her baby cool and comfortable under traditional nursing covers. No matter how many products she tried, little Sunny would emerge drenched in sweat from the combination of her mother’s body heat and the stifling temperatures outside.

products.name: Funky Mello Marshmellow Creme
products.description: Funky Mello is a line of plant-based marshmallow creams founded by entrepreneurs Zach and Delisa Harper. Based in Austin, Texas, the company is on a mission to reinvent the nostalgic flavors of classic marshmallow creme with a focus on high-quality, allergen-friendly ingredients.

products.name: Da Vinci Eye AR Drawing Tools
products.description: Founded in 2018 by New Yorker Samuel Gherman, Da Vinci Eye LLC is an ambitious startup utilizing augmented reality to reinvent artistic tools for the 21st century. Alongside co-founder and fellow entrepreneur Charissa Castillo, Gherman has led the company in developing a suite of groundbreaking apps that merge technology with traditional creative practices.

products.name: Fila Manila Filipino Sauces
products.description: Fila Manila is a Filipino-American food company that offers an award-winning line of authentic Filipino sauces, spreads, and condiments. The company was founded in 2020 by Jake Deleon, a first-generation Filipino-American immigrant entrepreneur.

products.name: Coldest Water Bottles
products.description: Coldest was founded in 2015 by twin brothers David Ahmad and Joe Ahmad, engineers who grew up in Florida. Headquartered in Naples, Florida, Coldest designs and manufactures water bottles, ice packs, bedding, clothing and other products aimed at keeping people and pets cool.

products.name: Psyonic Bionic Hand
products.description: Psyonic is a pioneering company in the field of bionic prosthetics, with a mission to make advanced prosthetic devices accessible to more people around the world. The company was founded by Dr. Aadeel Akhtar while he was a student at the University of Illinois. Akhtar’s goal for Psyonic is to develop affordable and advanced bionic prostheses that can help amputees regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

products.name: Cup-a-Bug Insect Catcher
products.description: Founded by inventor Justin Huang, Cup a Bug offers an innovative, humane way to catch and release unwelcome insects found around the home. The Cup a Bug consists of a cup attached to a long pole with a pivot mechanism, allowing users to easily catch bugs from various angles and hard-to-reach places.

products.name: Splashzen Bathtub Splash Guard
products.description: Splashzen is a company founded by husband and wife team Rodney and Tanya Rasmussen after struggling through countless bath times with their young sons. The Rasmussens knew there had to be a better solution than constantly telling their kids to stop splashing, only to end up with a soaked bathroom after each bath. After over 3 years of product development, focus groups with parents, and design iterations, the Rasmussens launched Splashzen to provide a splash guard that keeps bath water in the tub

products.name: Flora Smart Plant Monitor
products.description: Flora is a tech company that provides plant care solutions through their mobile app and smart plant monitor called the Flora Pod. The company was founded by Aabesh De, who was frustrated by constantly killing plants and wanted an easier way to learn about plant care while connecting with other plant parents.

products.name: How to be a Redhead
products.description: Adrienne Vendetti and Stephanie Vendetti are sisters and the co-founders of How to be a Redhead (known as H2BAR), the beauty brand for redheads. As authors of the “How to be a Redhead” beauty book, they curate the seasonal Deluxe H2BAR Beauty Subscription Box and the How to be a Redhead makeup line.

products.name: AU Baby Blankets
products.description: AU Baby is a modern baby product company founded by Alexandra Ulmer that provides natural, sustainable solutions for babies’ needs. The company’s name, pronounced “oh baby”, represents its purpose to create the best products for babies and the planet.

products.name: Modern Picnic Lunchbox Bags
products.description: Modern Picnic is a women-founded and led company that designs fashionable, functional, and sustainable lunch bags for professional women. The brand was launched in 2018 by Ali Kaminetsky with the mission to provide an alternative to the traditional lunchbox.

products.name: Meat the Mushroom Shroomacon
products.description: Meat the Mushroom is a plant-based food company founded in May 2021 and headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland by co-founders Marvin Montague Jr and his wife Aleah Montague. The company’s flagship product is Shroomacon, a vegan bacon made from sliced king oyster mushrooms instead of pork.

products.name: Deviled Egg Co
products.entrepreneur: with experience in scaling small businesses
products.description: Raechel Van Buskirk was managing a small Omaha bar when she tried something new for Sunday brunch — deviled eggs, but with a twist. Instead of the usual filling, she mixed in taco seasoning and topped them with crunchy garnishes. She set them out, not expecting much, but within minutes, the plate was empty. Customers kept asking for more. Week after week, the taco-style eggs became the star of brunch, and Raechel couldn’t ignore it.

products.name: Stringys Underwear
products.description: Olivia Karina and Elvira Tröger didn’t set out to start a fashion brand. They were just frustrated with their underwear. They loved wearing fitted clothes but hated dealing with visible panty lines. Going without underwear wasn’t an option, and the thongs they tried were either uncomfortable or showed through light fabrics. One night, while chatting over drinks, they started joking about how someone needed to invent “invisible underwear.” After throwing around ideas, they realized they might act

products.name: Big Ass Luxuries Candles
products.description: In February 2021, Texas was hit with an unexpected deep freeze, and the power went out across Dallas. Chloe and her husband, Trent, were stuck at home without heat or light. As the temperature dropped, they remembered the massive 200-ounce candle that friends had given them as a housewarming gift. They lit it and set it on the kitchen counter. For days, it kept the room warm and lit. When the power came back, the candle was still going.

products.name: Mirai Soaps and Body Care
products.description: Koko Hayashi never forgot the day her friend asked why her grandmother smelled strange. Koko was a child at the time, living with her family in Japan, and didn’t know how to respond. She loved her grandmother, who was always clean and careful with her appearance. But there was a distinct smell that Koko hadn’t noticed before. It wasn’t sweat or dirt. It was just different. Years later, Koko found out it wasn’t unusual. Japanese researchers had identified a specific odor that forms on aging skin.

products.name: Cricket’s Candy Creations
products.description: Leila “Cricket” Azima never planned to open a candy studio. She spent decades teaching kids to cook and think creatively about food. Her cooking school, The Creative Kitchen, focused on teaching children about healthy eating. For years, she hosted classes and festivals that promoted whole grains and vegetables, partnering with organizations like the James Beard Foundation. She loved seeing kids gain confidence in the kitchen.

products.name: Morrison Outdoors Sleeping Bags
products.description: Tavis Malcolm grew up backpacking and camping, and he always knew he’d share that experience with his own kids. When his first son, Morrison, was born, he started planning family trips, but one thing held him back — how to keep an infant warm while sleeping outdoors. On their first outing, he bundled Morrison up in extra layers and blankets, but the setup didn’t work. The baby was uncomfortable and cold, and Tavis spent half the night checking to make sure he was okay. He knew that taking a baby

products.name: Rocco Smart Fridge
products.description: Sam Naparstek stayed in dozens of rental apartments during his time leading product development at Away, the luggage company. One problem kept standing out: wine fridges were everywhere, but they were bulky, noisy, and stuck out awkwardly in living rooms. They all looked about the same—industrial designs that had not changed in decades. Sam began thinking about a better option, something that felt more like furniture but could still chill drinks. He hired an Italian designer to start sketching i

products.name: Fanion Onion Cutting Fan
products.description: Glenn Smith had cooked with onions for years, but no matter how often he chopped them, he could never find a way around the sting. He and his wife Maggie tried all the usual tricks—refrigerating the onions, breathing through the mouth, cutting under the fan—but none of it worked for long. Glenn hated how the fumes filled the air around the cutting board. The irritation was instant and always worse when he was in a rush. They started wondering why there wasn’t a simple tool to move the vapors awa

products.name: Jaju Pierogi
products.description: Sisters Casey and Vanessa White grew up in western Massachusetts surrounded by the smells and taste of their family’s Polish deli. Their grandfather, known affectionately as “Jaju” (Polish for “grandfather”), opened a small deli in the 1950s where he and his siblings made traditional pierogi and other Polish dishes. Casey and Vanessa spent childhood weekends helping in their grandparents’ kitchen and freezer, where batches of pierogi were always “tucked in the freezer” ready to warm up for famil

products.name: Permaplug Charger Lock
products.description: Zak Jones lived in a household where phone chargers always seemed to disappear. He was raising kids, juggling daily life, and watching the same small annoyance play out every week — someone borrowed a charger and forgot to return it, or it vanished completely. He bought more than he wanted to count. At some point, he stopped thinking about the charger itself and started focusing on the outlet. The problem wasn’t just the cord. It was that the entire charger could be pulled out too easily.

products.name: Essence Aromatherapy Ring
products.description: The story of Essence began on an airplane. Michael DeLeeuw, a financial services professional who traveled frequently for work, found himself on back-to-back flights seated next to passengers with overpowering odors – one heavy with cigarette smoke, another with strong body odor. Struggling through those flights, Michael realized there had to be a way to take control of the scents in his personal space. This sparked the idea of using aromatherapy to mask unpleasant smells and improve the travel

products.name: Mad Mutz Mozzarella Sticks
products.description: Mad Mutz Mozzarella Laboratory is an Atlantic City-based company specializing in gourmet mozzarella sticks. It was co-founded in 2024 by Michael Steven “Mike” Hauke, a New Jersey restaurateur known for the Tony Boloney’s pizzeria chain, together with his friend Michael Burns. Mad Mutz produces flavored, fresh mozzarella sticks in a variety of creative flavors, using whole ingredients and no fillers. The company’s production facility (dubbed a “mozzarella laboratory”) can churn out tens of thousa

products.name: Go Nutz Razor
products.description: Landon McKinnis started Private Grooming, LLC in 2019 as a vehicle to create a better body-grooming device. A self-described grooming enthusiast, McKinnis was motivated by personal experience: like many others, he had tried popular shaving tools that promised to be safe and effective, only to be disappointed by nicks, irritation, or ineffectiveness. This frustration sparked the idea for a new kind of trimmer. In McKinnis’s words, he wanted a product that would let people “go nuts” shaving sensit

products.name: Frame Your Feline
products.description: Frame Your Feline was conceived by Kristina Hughes and Brian Vermeire as a creative solution to a common pet problem. The Los Angeles-based couple are avid cat lovers (parents to seven rescue cats) and found themselves frustrated with traditional cat furniture. After rescuing over ten cats over the years, they had numerous bulky, carpeted cat trees in their home that were hard to clean and took up valuable space. Hughes and Vermeire, both stand-up comedians by trade, decided to apply their creat

products.name: Sock Candy Women’s Socks
products.entrepreneur: can still carve out a unique niche – one pair of candy-colored socks at a time
products.description: Mary Yashan Gui didn’t start her career in fashion. She immigrated from China to the United States at age seven and grew up with traditional expectations to pursue a stable profession (think business, medicine, or law). Following this path, she attended business school and earned a marketing degree, then spent five years working at a large advertising agency. The corporate work—often promoting unexciting products like arthritis medications—left her feeling unfulfilled. Seeking a more creative ou

products.name: Jane Foodie Frozen Foods
products.entrepreneur: with a knack for spotting unmet needs in the market
products.description: Jane Foodie was born out of founder Jane E. Carroll’s remarkable journey of reinvention. Carroll began her career far from the kitchen – as a floral designer in the Bronx – but quickly found success as an entrepreneur. In 2002, her creative “Boxed in Blooms” floral arrangements caught the attention of Oprah Winfrey, leading to features on Oprah’s Favorite Things and an appearance on The Oprah Winfrey Show in 2005. This early acclaim made Carroll a nationally recognized name in design, with her w

products.name: Airtulip Air Purifying Headboard
products.description: AirTulip is a New York-based startup that develops cleanroom-grade air purification systems to create “bubbles” of contaminant-free air in everyday indoor spaces. The company’s technology was born during the COVID-19 pandemic and uses controlled laminar airflow (inspired by industrial cleanrooms) to remove airborne viruses, allergens, and pollutants from rooms ranging from offices to bedrooms. Below is an overview of AirTulip’s founding, products, milestones, and the background of founder Arjen

products.name: Paper Tacos Greeting Cards
products.description: Paper Tacos is a greeting card business founded by Jesús Ruvalcaba. The company focuses on creating culturally specific cards that reflect the traditions, humor, and language of the Latino community. Based in Salinas, California, Paper Tacos sells greeting cards in Spanish, often using Spanglish and references familiar to many Mexican American households.

products.name: Future Circus Mixed Reality
products.description: Future Circus is a mixed reality entertainment venture co-founded by Brent Bushnell and Aiden Wolf. The company develops immersive experiences that combine physical spaces with digital overlays. Its flagship project, Dream Park, is a mixed reality theme park that overlays mapped digital content on real-world locations. The first installation opened in Santa Monica, California, covering 30,000 square feet of public space along the 3rd Street Promenade.

products.name: Cowpots Biodegradable Pots
products.description: CowPots is a biodegradable pot manufacturer based on a third-generation dairy farm in northwest Connecticut. The business was founded by the Freund family, who began dairy farming in 1949. Today, the second and third generations manage two farm businesses: Canaan View Dairy and Freund’s Farm Market & Bakery. The dairy operation provides the manure used to create CowPots, while the market and garden center utilize the pots for growing produce and flowers.

products.name: BAM Plant-based Milk
products.description: BAM (Because Agriculture Matters) is a mission-driven food startup offering America’s first plant-based milk made from buckwheat. The company officially launched its flagship BAM Buckwheat Milk in November 2023, introducing a new non-dairy alternative aimed at improving both personal health and agricultural sustainability. Founded by Paige Hansen, BAM was created to diversify the crops used in our food system – starting with buckwheat – in order to support soil health, climate resilience, and nu

products.name: Blackdot Automatic Tattooing Device
products.description: Blackdot is an Austin-based startup that is blending technology with body art to transform how tattoos are designed and delivered. Founded by serial entrepreneur Joel Pennington, the company has developed the world’s first fully automated tattooing device and an online marketplace for tattoo art. This innovative platform—dubbed “A New Way to Tattoo”—aims to make highly detailed tattoo designs more accessible while creating new opportunities for artists. Below, we explore Blackdot’s business hist

products.name: Firefly Workout Recovery Device
products.description: Firefly Recovery is a Los Angeles-based company that provides a wearable athletic recovery device designed to enhance muscle recovery for athletes. Its flagship product is a small, portable neuromuscular stimulator that increases blood circulation to help reduce soreness and speed up recovery time. Clinically validated and FDA-approved, the Firefly device has been adopted by hundreds of sports teams at the professional and collegiate levels. Founded in 2017, the company has grown its reach acros

products.name: Duzter Cut Resistant Hockey Apparel
products.description: Duzter is a Maryland-based hockey protective gear company founded by a father-and-son duo, Martin Negron Jr. and Martin Negron Sr., in 2022. The business emerged from their shared goal of making hockey safer and more affordable for young players. Headquartered in Annapolis, Duzter specializes in cut-resistant compression apparel that protects players from skate blade injuries while providing comfort on the ice.

products.name: Hella Awkward by Awkward Games
products.description: Awkward Games was born during the height of the COVID-19 lockdown in New York City. In mid-2020, Brittane Rowe teamed up with her brother, Brandon Rhodes, and his partner, Jane Lim, to create something positive out of a lonely time. The trio, who identify as Black, Asian, family- and immigrant-founded, felt a need for human connection when social gatherings were on hold. Drawing from their own experiences of conversations that weren’t happening in their communities growing up, they envisioned a

products.name: Dig World Construction Equipment for Kids
products.entrepreneur: to open new Dig World locations in other cities
products.description: Dig World is the first construction equipment-themed adventure park in Texas, offering children and adults the chance to operate real heavy machinery in a safe environment. The concept was inspired by founder Jacob Robinson’s young son, Pierce, who has a deep love for construction trucks and machinery. In 2017, Pierce survived a severe case of bacterial meningitis that left him with significant disabilities, yet his enthusiasm for construction remained undimmed. Robinson and his wife wanted to c

products.name: Riverbend Resources Poultry Care
products.entrepreneur: as he took on everything from product development and patenting to branding and distribution for his fledgling company
products.description: A few years ago, Erik Diedrichsen and his family moved from city life in Boston to a rural town in eastern Massachusetts, where they found themselves embracing the homesteading lifestyle almost by accident. It all started with a couple of baby chicks gifted from a relative’s school project – before long, the Diedrichsen household was tending a backyard flock of chickens, harvesting maple syrup, and even keeping beehives. As their small farm grew, Erik relished producing fresh eggs, honey, and sy

products.name: Domedock Hat Rack
products.entrepreneur: was a significant milestone – it meant the DomeDock business could support their family financially and deserved their complete focus
products.description: The story of DomeDock began in 2019 in Lubbock, Texas. John Giles was an avid hat collector struggling with a “hat problem” – he owned too many ball caps and had no good way to store them neatly. John, a natural tinkerer, decided to craft a solution for his own use. He built the first DomeDock prototypes by hand, creating a wall-mounted rack that could stack caps on top of each other, keeping them organized and accessible. His wife, Chelsea Giles, immediately saw the broader potential of this cl

products.name: Kiid Coffee for Kids
products.entrepreneur: with a background in polymer and fiber engineering from Georgia Tech
products.description: Kiid Coffee, founded by David Sanborn and his son Ethan, offers a beverage designed for children that provides essential nutrients without the high caffeine content found in traditional coffee. The company started as a personal solution for Ethan’s nutritional needs and evolved into a business that challenges the standards of children’s beverages. With a focus on organic ingredients and a nutrient-rich formula, Kiid Coffee introduces an alternative to sugary drinks and standard multivitamins.

products.name: Happy Birdwatcher Birdseed
products.description: Happy Birdwatcher is a company that provides high-quality, customized birdseed blends designed to attract specific bird species based on regional data. Founded by Susan Vandergriff, the company offers tailored birdseed that helps customers create vibrant backyard birdwatching experiences. What began as a personal journey of relaxation and discovery has turned into a business that now serves customers across 49 states.

products.name: GoodLove Foods Gluten-free Baked Goods
products.description: GoodLove Foods specializes in gluten-free, frozen, ready-to-bake products designed for those with celiac disease and others seeking gluten-free options. Founded by Chennelle Diong and her husband, GoodLove Foods aims to provide high-quality baked goods that are not only gluten-free but also safe for those with severe gluten intolerance. The company operates from a dedicated gluten-free facility to ensure product safety and quality.

products.name: Lectic Electric Skateboard & Scooter Kits
products.description: Lectec was founded by Jared Ebersole and Luke St. Amand. Jared, now the CEO of Lectec, started his entrepreneurial journey at 15 when he created a company that sold build-it-yourself electric skateboard kits for adults. His interest in engineering was sparked when he built and sold his first electric skateboard after watching a video online. Over time, he became a self-taught electrical and mechanical engineer, designing, manufacturing, and selling skateboard components from his parents’ basemen

products.name: Bumpeez Bumper Cars
products.description: Bumpeez is a toy company that designs and manufactures inflatable character bumper cars for young children. Founded in 2022 by Michael Bergida and Israel Schaya, the company focuses on providing a safe and entertaining ride-on toy that brings the excitement of amusement park bumper cars into homes. The company designs its products with parents in mind, ensuring a balance between fun and safety.

products.name: FlaminGO Phone Charger
products.description: Smith Baggett founded FlaminGO Charger in 2018. As a fourth-generation cattle rancher and auctioneer, Baggett pursued his entrepreneurial interests by creating a portable charging solution. The company is based in Savannah, Georgia, a city known for its blend of historical charm and modern energy.

products.name: Joyebells Pies
products.entrepreneur: of the Year for the Mid-Atlantic Region by Ernst & Young in the same year
products.description: Joyebells is a family-owned pie company founded by Joye B. Moore in 2019. The company specializes in sweet potato, peach, pumpkin, and apple pies, all crafted from family recipes that have been passed down for six generations. The recipes originated with Joye B. Moore’s great-great-great-grandmother, Susan Mae Howell, and have been preserved and refined by generations of family bakers. Moore is the first in her family to turn these traditional recipes into a business.

products.name: Forte 3D Carbon Fiber Instruments
products.description: Alfred Goodrich had been a cellist for most of his life. He played classical concerts, recorded original music, taught students, and ran a studio in Pennsylvania. Like most musicians who make a living off their instrument, he knew its strengths and flaws inside and out. He also knew what it meant to take a cello on the road—how the wood reacted to dry air, how sensitive it was to temperature shifts, how easily it could crack. At some point, he started experimenting with carbon fiber instruments,

products.name: Shalom Japan Matzoh Ball Ramen Kits
products.description: Aaron Israel and Sawa Okochi opened Shalom Japan in Williamsburg after years of working side by side in New York kitchens. They had already built a life together, and opening a restaurant that blended their backgrounds—his Jewish, hers Japanese—felt like the most natural thing in the world. The menu wasn’t built around a concept or a gimmick. It was just the kind of food they wanted to make. Dishes drifted between cultures, or sometimes landed right in the middle. A bowl of lox with pickled daik

products.name: Surf Skull Surfing Helmet
products.description: Paul Huang was watching waves crash on the beach in Santa Cruz when his friend Davon Larson walked up wearing a bucket hat that looked like it had something hidden inside. Davon, who’d surfed for years and had a background in design, had been quietly working on a project since taking a bad hit from a fin in the head during a trip to Mexico. The cut was small, but the impact shook him. It didn’t feel like a close call at the time, but later it stuck with him. That’s how things often start—quietly

products.name: Tantos Puffed Pasta Chips
products.description: Sean Knecht wasn’t looking to start another company when he first messaged Joe Sasto on Instagram. He just wanted help making better pasta. Sean had already built a startup before, a pet product brand called PrideBites, and he had been through the pace and pressure of running a business. Cooking was his creative escape—something he did for fun, especially after long workdays. He had been following Joe, who was gaining attention as the guy with the handle @chef.joe.sasto, posting videos of handma

products.name: Lila Birth Gowns
products.description: Caitlyn Schollmeier spent years working in maternity care – first as a medic in the U.S. Air Force, then as a labor and delivery nurse and birth doula. During this time she noticed a persistent problem: the standard-issue hospital gowns worn during childbirth were uncomfortable, undignified, and left many women feeling exposed. “I never liked seeing hospital gowns in the labor and delivery setting,” Caitlyn said. “Women should be free to wear anything they want… in whichever way makes them feel

products.name: The Qi Flower Tea
products.description: Lisa Li didn’t set out to sell flowers. She had a job in fashion, a full calendar, and no plans to leave it behind. But the pace wore her down. After years in New York, working long hours, pushing through stress and burnout, her body started pushing back. She was diagnosed with a thyroid condition. Doctors offered surgery or lifelong medication. She hesitated. Instead, she flew home.

products.name: Freestyle Snacks Olives & Pickle Chips
products.description: It started with a broken olive bar. Nikki Seaman was living in Atlanta when the grocery stores closed theirs down. Pandemic rules. She’d only just become an olive person—those briny, oil-soaked green ones you scoop into a little plastic tub at Whole Foods or the fancier Kroger locations. They were salty, chewy, sometimes spicy, always satisfying. She looked for an alternative, but what was left were jars of olives suspended in brine. The texture was off. They were soft in a way she didn’t like.

products.name: Warrior Kid Medic
products.description: At the Titzman family’s dining table in rural Texas, eight-year-old Everly Titzman and her six-year-old sister Adeline calmly tend to a “punctured” plastic arm. They pack a gauze roll into a gaping wound and cinch an orange bandana around the faux limb as a tourniquet. “Shove it in there… you’re saving a life,” Everly grins, echoing her father’s training. It’s not a scene from a paramedic class but an ordinary evening at home. Dustin and Michelle Titzman’s four children have, in a sense, grown u

products.name: The Sprouting Company
products.description: Doug Evans was living out in the Mojave Desert—off the grid, no grocery stores, no Whole Foods down the road, just dirt and rocks and silence. He had gone raw vegan years earlier after his parents got sick—cancer, heart disease. So food wasn’t just food. It was the thing he used to keep himself alive.

products.name: Orka Bar Protein Ice Cream Bar
products.description: Stephen Longo used to eat Klondike bars as a kid. The ones in the silver wrapper with the soft ice cream middle and the crackle of chocolate on the outside. His mom always kept a few in the freezer. Later, after college, after the finance job, after all the gym stuff, he started thinking about them again.

products.name: Alchemize Fightwear
products.description: Maya Nazareth got into Brazilian jiu-jitsu in her teens and immediately noticed something: the gear sucked. At least for women.

products.name: Snorinator Anti-snoring Pillow
products.description: Lloyd Ecker snored so loudly that his wife Susan made him sleep on the couch. He tried nasal strips, mouthpieces, adjustable beds—none of it helped. One night, while searching online, he came across a medical description of something called the “Fowler’s position,” a steep reclining angle used in hospitals to help patients breathe more easily. The next night he stacked pillows to imitate it and slept without waking himself up.

products.name: QB54 Backyard Football Game
products.description: Michael and Frank Silva were always competitive. As kids growing up in New Jersey, they spent every Thanksgiving facing off in the backyard. Their game wasn’t traditional football. They had two garbage cans set up at opposite ends of the yard and used their father’s metal antenna as a field goal post. You scored by sinking the football into the can or bouncing it off the antenna. No tackling. No teams. Just two brothers throwing passes until it got dark.

products.name: Im’peccable Chicken
products.description: Melina Chang couldn’t find anything like the vacuum-sealed chicken snacks she saw in Taiwan. On a trip there, she noticed ready-to-eat seasoned chicken breasts sold in 7‑Elevens and convenience stores. Fully cooked, lightly flavored, no utensils needed. The idea stuck.

products.name: Doublesoul Socks
products.description: Allison Strumeyer had drawers full of ones that looked cool but sagged and bunched, and plenty that fit right but came in only black, white, or gray. She couldn’t find a pair of socks that did both. The bright, playful ones usually came from novelty shops and felt cheap. The performance socks looked like gym wear and didn’t pair well with anything else. She and her partner, Ben Rosenbaum, started wondering why the options were so split—style or comfort, but never both.

products.name: Z-Coil Spring Shoes
products.description:
Alvaro Gallegos took up running after his wife passed away. He was nearly 60 and looking for a way to stay healthy. But it didn’t take long before pain in his knees and back made running difficult. He kept running anyway. Then he started cutting open his shoes.

products.name: Dad Strength Brewing
products.description: Craig Carey and Ryan Kutscher co-founded Dad Strength Brewing in Washington, D.C., focusing on craft beers with lower alcohol. The two longtime friends, both new fathers, were tired of the punishing buzz of high-ABV beers and began mixing regular and nonalcoholic beers to create a drink around 3% ABV. products.name: Pelagion Hydroblade
products.description: Jamie Schlinkmann kept an old Kawasaki Jet Ski from the 1970s. It didn’t run anymore, but he held on to it. He remembered standing up on it as a kid, the way it carved across the lake and kicked out spray. Years later, long after he’d built a career designing machines for factories, he looked at it again and wondered if there was a way to bring that feeling back—without the noise, the fumes, or the bulk of a gas engine.
